auth._context_mfa_required: Page heading shown when user must complete MFA to proceed
auth.mfa_verification_required: 需要 MFA 验证才能访问您的账户
auth._context_complete_mfa_verification: Primary button text to submit MFA verification

security._README: ⚠️ SECURITY-CRITICAL: Messages prevent information disclosure. See src/locales/SECURITY-TRANSLATION-GUIDE.md
security.authentication_failed: 认证失败。请验证您的凭据并重试。
security.rate_limited: 尝试次数过多。请稍后重试。
security.session_expired: 会话已过期。请重新登录。
security.recovery_code_not_found: 未找到恢复代码。请验证您输入是否正确。
security.recovery_code_used: 此恢复代码已被使用。每个代码只能使用一次。
security.network_error: 网络错误。请检查您的连接并重试。

_meta._purpose: These messages follow OWASP/NIST guidelines to prevent information disclosure. Translations MUST maintain generic wording to prevent credential enumeration and timing attacks. Never reveal: which credential failed, precise timing, account existence, or attack progress.

authentication_failed.security_note: MUST NOT reveal which credential failed (password, OTP, or recovery code). This prevents attackers from determining valid credentials or enumerating accounts.
authentication_failed.owasp_ref: ASVS 2.2.2 - Authentication failure responses must be generic

rate_limited.security_note: MUST NOT reveal precise lockout duration, attempt counts, or remaining attempts. This prevents timing attacks and progress tracking.
rate_limited.owasp_ref: ASVS 2.2.1 - Account lockout must not be timing-based enumerable

session_expired.security_note: Safe to indicate session issue as it doesn't reveal credential information. Helps users understand they need to re-authenticate.

recovery_code_not_found.security_note: Safe to indicate recovery code context as user explicitly selected this authentication method. Does not reveal whether code exists.

recovery_code_used.security_note: Safe expected behavior message. Users need to know recovery codes are single-use to prevent confusion.

MUST_translate_as: Generic rate limit message (no precise timing)
_translation_guidelines.WHY: These restrictions prevent attackers from: (1) determining valid usernames/emails, (2) knowing which credential to focus attacks on, (3) conducting timing attacks, (4) measuring attack progress

_safe_information.format_requirements: Safe to specify format rules (e.g., 'OTP must be 6 digits')
_safe_information.expected_behavior: Safe to describe how features work (e.g., 'Codes expire every 30 seconds')
_safe_information.recovery_options: Safe to offer alternatives (e.g., 'Use a recovery code instead')
_safe_information.general_guidance: Safe to provide help (e.g., 'Check your authenticator app')
